channel.title: Ruby on Rails
channel.description:
Hi guys, I've been interested in learning web. development and certain programming languages in general, and discovered through a friend that RoR would be better off to learn before a language such as php. I don't really know anything about the language itself besides it using a framework called "rails" to assist for web. development, but I'd like some resources to gather so I could start learning how to utilize it's code, what it does, and so on.
I recently purchased this book (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1118008189/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1) regarding html and css. I'm nearly half way through it and it covered pretty much what I already knew about HTML. I'm just about getting started on the CSS chapters. I'm trying to make my way through web. development as well as designing.
If anyone has some recommendations for books on it, I'd be more than delighted to purchase some. (preferably through Amazon) I'd also hope if someone could spare a few doc links on RoR or any other web. development assists that could help me.

item.title: Ruby on Rails
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:6, topic:542829”][quote author=SRBuckey5266 link=topic=661705.msg4426246#msg4426246 date=1400981457]

Why not go to a place actually dedicated to programming with actual programmers? SO (StackOverflow) is good for these kind of questions. I’m sure it’s already been answered over there.

why dont you stop posting if you want to say people here “aren’t real programmers”. second post of yours i’ve read that is like this. fudge off

judging by your post history you’re a real idiot just leave

Why don’t you just accept the truth?
[/quote]
We are a site dedicated to programming with actual programmers. You don’t need a degree to call yourself one. Just because we are a small niche doesn’t mean we aren’t a site properly equipped for these types of questions.[/quote]

Moparscape isn’t a site dedicated to just programming, and you don’t have to be an actual programmer (meaning that you have a degree) to answer or ask questions about programming.

Moparscape is a forums, not a Q&A setup. If you look at the boards here, you see boards like Games, Graphics, Reviews and Multimedia, Music, etc. The statement we are a site dedicated to programming with actual programmers, is completely invalid. The description for StackOverflow is…

[b]Stack Overflow[/b] is a question and answer site for professional and enthusiast programmers. It's 100% free, no registration required.

Moparscape’s slogan is The Mother of RS Private Servers. Which is mostly true. If anything, these forums are more directed towards Runescape private servers.

@SRBuckey5266 - Moparscape has boards for programming, and those boards are usually where programmers hang out. Someone with out a degree can easily know more than someone who has a degree. It doesn’t matter if someone is actual, there isn’t necessarily a thing as an actual programmer. I do agree that if a user has a question, and they ask here and don’t get a response, their next step should be StackOverflow.

Read full topic
